question: Consider the following 4 electrodes:
A: <katex>$Ag^+(0.0001M)/Ag$</katex>
B: <katex>$Ag^+(0.1M)/Ag$</katex>
C: <katex>$Ag^+(0.01M)/Ag$</katex>
D: <katex>$Ag^+(0.001M)/Ag$</katex>
The order of reduction potential is:
explanation: According to Nernst equation, <katex>$E = E^0 + 0.059 \log[Ag^+]$</katex>. The potential increases with increasing concentration of metal ion. <katex>$0.1 > 0.01 > 0.001 > 0.0001$</katex>. Order: B > C > D > A.
